image.altText: The charred remains of a burnt home.

props.synopsis: One in 10 homes could be effectively uninsurable by 2050, while lost labour productivity to extreme weather could wipe $211 billion in household wealth, the Climate Risk Assessment warns.

title.children: One million homes at 'very high risk' will be effectively uninsurable by 2050

image.altText: Aerial of emergency crews in yellow hazmat suits on gravel path

props.synopsis: One person dies and several others, including police officers, receive medical treatment after a gas leak at a restaurant in north-west Sydney.

title.children: Breaking: One dead, six hospitalised after gas leak at Sydney restaurant

image.altText: a woman with brown hair speaking in front of a blue and green background

props.synopsis: The communications minister and eSafety commissioner have released guidelines for social media platforms ahead of the government's social media ban for children under 16. Follow live.

title.children: Government releases guidelines for social media platforms ahead of teen ban

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Platforms won't be required to verify age of every user
Government releases guidelines for social media platforms ahead of under 16s ban
'Mass exodus' from Coalition front bench if it adopts net zero 'at any cost' approach

image.altText: A police vehicle spraying protesters with water.

props.synopsis: Months before anti-immigrant unrest broke out on the streets of London, it erupted in this small UK town.

title.children: Before London erupted, this UK town burnt migrants out of their homes

image.altText: A woman faces a man in a room. Both are in silouhette.

props.synopsis: A Goodstart worker who allegedly abused toddlers at a Ballarat centre speaks out for the first time and says he is appealing after being banned from working with children.

title.children: Childcare worker speaks out after being accused of abusing toddlers

image.altText: A line of men hold rifles.

props.synopsis: Australia and Papua New Guinea will be legally obliged to defend each other from a military attack on either territory under a landmark defence treaty, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: 'Bite like a crocodile': More details of Australia-PNG defence treaty emerge

image.altText: A man with long grey hair tied into a ponytail looks down at a mobile phone he's holding in his hands.

props.synopsis: The Plymouth Brethren Christian Church is fiercely protective of a multi-billion-dollar business which supports the church. These men found out the extraordinary lengths it will take to keep it safe.

title.children: David was told to find an ex-member of the secretive Brethren. He told them to run

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Wall Street's S&P 500 and Nasdaq hit record closes ahead of the Fed's interest rate decision, while the Australian banking sector digests a tumultuous week. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street waits on the Fed's interest rate decision

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: New research says narcissistic bosses are bad for business
ANZ risks reputational damage, says man who tallies the score
Trump economic adviser Miran gets Senate nod to join Fed board

props.synopsis: Donald Trump signs a memorandum to send the National Guard into Memphis to combat crime, setting up another major test of his presidential power.

title.children: Trump signs order to send National Guard into Memphis

image.altText: Police headshots of the front and side of a young Caucasian man.

props.synopsis: Tyler Robinson, 22, was arrested last week over the death of conservative influencer Charlie Kirk.

title.children: DNA at crime scene matches Charlie Kirk murder suspect, FBI says

image.altText: A boat on fire at sea in vision marked as "unclassified"

props.synopsis: United States President Donald Trump says the American military carried out a strike on a Venezuelan drug cartel vessel that had been on its way to the US.

title.children: Three dead after US strikes alleged Venezuelan drug vessel

image.altText: a woman holding a cup of tea

props.synopsis: Albany woman Debby Butler says she had to ask strangers to help her to the bathroom after Rex delayed her flight home from Perth Airport and left her without a wheelchair.

title.children: Wheelchair user left to fend for herself during six-hour Rex flight delay

image.altText: An illustration of a child looking angry and confused standing on a table with people surrounding her

props.synopsis: A surge of professional and personal interest in Pathological Demand Avoidance (PDA), an autism subtype — which in children can affect everything from cleaning teeth to attending school — has led to Australia's first-ever PDA conference, to be held in Perth in November.

title.children: Surge of interest in autism subtype leads to national conference

image.altText: A 'sold' sticker being placed on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: Lawyers urge Australians to ensure they leave behind a valid will to avoid legal disputes as surging house prices and superannuation balances increase the size of inheritances.

title.children: Thousands of Australians contesting wills as property prices soar

image.altText: An empty Victorian building train station, cream and red, in the country, trees, and blue skies and no building in site.

props.synopsis: Daniel Kelly broke his leg after he stepped off a V/Line train only to discover the carriage had outrun the platform at his local station.

title.children: V/Line passenger falls from train and breaks leg due to short platform

image.altText: A middle aged white woman with white hair and a young white male with brown hair sitting in a park

props.synopsis: As the Albanese government seeks to rein in the cost of the NDIS, a former Australian of the Year says money could be saved with this one shift.

title.children: The NDIS could save billions with this change, expert says

image.altText: Man and woman seated in dark stadium

props.synopsis: The first golden group of inductees were honoured at an event that threw back to the Sydney 2000 games with Nikki Webster reproducing her iconic opening ceremony performance.

title.children: Sydney Olympics heroes and Nikki Webster mark 25 year since Games

image.altText: A woman with short hair wearing a green blazer speaks to the camera in front of a Liberal party backdrop.

props.synopsis: Kerrynne Liddle speaks for the first time since Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was dumped from the frontbench, saying the pair are "on a unity ticket" when it comes to Indigenous affairs.

title.children: Shadow Minister on 'unity ticket' with dumped Senator Nampijinpa Price

image.altText: A hand holds a mobile phone with the screen showing several social media apps

props.synopsis: While substantial fines would apply to social media platforms that make no effort to ban under-16s, they would not need to test the age of every user.

title.children: Social media platforms will not be required to prove accuracy of under-16 bans

image.altText: Two metal grey F-16 fighter jets flying side-by-side in the air amid light cloud cover

props.synopsis: Polish authorities neutralise a drone flying above government buildings in Warsaw on Monday night, as the country remains on high alert following recent Russian drone incursions.

title.children: Poland arrests two Belarusians after drone flown over Warsaw presidential palace

image.altText: A palawa woman stands facing the camera in front of an artwork

props.synopsis: Forty years ago, the federal government used the constitution to halt construction of the Franklin Dam. Now lawyers want the Albanese government to do the same to keep kids out of jails.

title.children: Experts say jails cause kids 'irreversible trauma'. They want Albanese to act

image.altText: a man with dark features and a beard smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A councillor is demanding answers from his own executive over the botched Bendigo Writers Festival, asking colleagues whether they want to be remembered as the council that "killed" it.

title.children: Bendigo residents asking 'what the hell happened to the writers festival?'

image.altText: ANZ signage

props.synopsis: ASIC has lived by that aphorism in its decision to strike a settlement deal with ANZ over a raft of wrongdoing.

title.children: ANZ commits bank errors in its favour. Is there any other kind?

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: SA Police says it is investigating an employee's social media posts, after they allegedly made a post celebrating the assassination of the US right-wing political activist Charlie Kirk.

title.children: SA Police investigating social media post allegedly made by employee celebrating death of Charlie Kirk

image.altText: A man in a red shirt holding a boy with a football

props.synopsis: The long-time nightly newsreader says it was an "instant choice" to leave work as his daughter faced a battle with cancer.

title.children: Family comes first for newsreader Rob Brough after months off-air

image.altText: A human skeleton, partially excavated from grey-brown sand.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists claim they've found the oldest-known deliberately mummified remains in burial sites across China and South-East Asia, with some individuals dating back 14,000 years.

title.children: Vietnam mummy predates Egyptian examples by nearly 10,000 years

image.altText: A man kneels above two large rusty unexploded shells, measuring one of them with measuring tape.

props.synopsis: Trainees in Papua New Guinea will learn to remove unexploded ordnance, as fading memories of World War II expose more people to the conflict's dangerous legacy.

title.children: PNG's memories of WWII are fading — at a deadly cost for communities

image.altText: Andrew Hastie doorstop at CPH 2024-04-17 10:04:00

props.synopsis: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Hastie indicates he will quit or be dumped from the shadow cabinet if the Coalition does not abandon the target of achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.

title.children: Hastie flags demotion or resignation should Liberals not abandon net zero

image.altText: A man with white hair bites his finger.

props.synopsis: The remarks were made as US Secretary of State Marco Rubio visited Israel seeking answers from Mr Netanyahu about how Israel intended to proceed in Gaza.

title.children: Israel's Netanyahu won't rule out striking Hamas 'wherever they are'

image.altText: Prince Charles and Donald Trump walking on a lawn, dressed in suits.

props.synopsis: The US president will arrive in London on Tuesday evening, local time, for an unprecedented second state visit to the country.

title.children: Castles, trade and Epstein: What's looming over Donald Trump's UK visit

image.altText: Townsville protest

props.synopsis: It comes in the wake of anti-immigration rallies held around the country where some blamed "mass migration" for families not being able to afford a home.

title.children: Building industry calls for more migrant workers to address housing crisis

image.altText: A tiger lounges in short grass at Vantara's facility.

props.synopsis: Conservationists had raised concerns about Vantara but investigators say the issues raised are "devoid of merit".

title.children: 'World's biggest' wild animal rescue centre cleared of wrongdoing

image.altText: two men hold baby and check their temperature

props.synopsis: Work demands and a lack of village mean keeping a child at home from care every time they have a sniffle can be a dilemma for many parents. So when it it OK to send them?

title.children: Is it ever OK to send a sick kid to child care?

image.altText: Tia-Clair Toomey-Orr squats with her arms open to hug her daughter at the CrossFit Games.

props.synopsis: Tia-Clair Toomey-Orr has been considered the CrossFit GOAT for some time, and she is not slowing down.

title.children: Motherhood changed Tia-Clair Toomey's perspective, but not her drive

image.altText: A smiling woman a white feathery dress squats down and reaches out in front of a reflective background.

props.synopsis: The internationally renowned Maori artist's technically complex, visually mesmerising exhibition spans nearly a decade of artwork.

title.children: Lisa Reihana's exhibition, Voyager, recasts history through an Indigenous lens
